page.title: 12RHYMNEY VALLEY-ECOLOGY (2)
page.content: In the Rhymney Valley, kingfishers are now found to be nesting along the river banks and the peregrine has been observed in the upland regions. Mammals, which have made an appearance, include foxes,hedgehogs, rabbits and moles, with the upland region supporting hares,badgers,weasles and stoats. The Heads of the Valleys Road has provided a haven for the small rodents, with sparrowhawks and kestrels being frequent visitors. Although there are a number of well established trees in the valley bottoms,there has been a conscious effort by the Authority to plant trees in other areas. The River Rhymney is, once again, supporting fish and, in some stretches, trout can be found.
